content: The following lists events that happened during **1989 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The first [24-hour](/wiki/24-hour) radio station in Singapore, [Perfect Ten 98.7FM](/wiki/987FM), starts broadcast. - 13 January – The [Public Works Department](/wiki/CPG_Corporation) announced the building of two bridges to [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa) and [Pulau Brani](/wiki/Pulau_Brani), which will be completed by 1992. - 15 January – TransitLink starts operations, which is formed by [SMRT](/wiki/SMRT_Corporation), [Singapore Bus Services](/wiki/SBS_Transit) and [Trans-Island Bus Services](/wiki/SMRT_Buses) to develop an integrated bus-rail public transport system. ### February - 21 February – [Tradewinds](/wiki/SilkAir#History) starts its first flight, which is formed in 1975 as a hotelier. ### April - 14 April – The [National Skin Centre](/wiki/National_Skin_Centre) is officially opened to treat [skin diseases](/wiki/Skin_diseases) and research skin conditions. - 30 April – [Change Alley](/wiki/Change_Alley,_Singapore) closes its doors. It reopens as an air-conditioned passageway in 1993. ### June - 10 June – The New Psychiatric Hospital (now known as the [Institute of Mental Health](/wiki/Institute_of_Mental_Health_(Singapore))) starts construction, which has state of the art facilities when completed. ### August - 26 August – The first community hospital starts construction in [Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio). The hospital will have community involvement with the participation of family doctors. ### September - 1 September – The [Urban Redevelopment Authority](/wiki/Urban_Redevelopment_Authority) is revamped, taking over [land use planning](/wiki/Land_use_planning) from the [Ministry of National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)). This results in the transfer of properties to Pidemco Land (present day [CapitaLand](/wiki/CapitaLand)). ### November - 1 November – The [National Youth Council](/wiki/National_Youth_Council_Singapore) is formed as a division of the [People's Association](/wiki/People%27s_Association) to work on youth matters. - 4 November – The sixth section of the [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) system is opened from [Marina Bay](/wiki/Marina_Bay_MRT_station) to [Tanah Merah](/wiki/Tanah_Merah_MRT_station). - 6 November – Singapore is one of the founding members of the [Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation](/wiki/Asia-Pacific_Economic_Cooperation) (APEC). ### December - 6–10 December – [1989 World Badminton Grand Prix](/wiki/1989_World_Badminton_Grand_Prix) is held. - 16 December – The seventh section of the [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) system is opened from [Simei](/wiki/Simei_MRT_station) to [Pasir Ris](/wiki/Pasir_Ris_MRT_station). - 28 December – [SingTel](/wiki/SingTel) launches its [ISDN](/wiki/ISDN) network, making Singapore the first in the world to have ISDN nationwide. - 31 December – [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium) was officially opened in an inaugural ceremony by the [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore), [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew). ## Births - 19 February – [Xu Bin](/wiki/Xu_Bin), actor. - 1 March – [Joshua Ang](/wiki/Joshua_Ang), actor. - 23 May – [Tosh Zhang](/wiki/Tosh_Zhang), actor. - 18 June – [Gen Neo](/wiki/Gen_Neo), [K-Pop](/wiki/K-Pop) singer. - 18 August – [Yu Mengyu](/wiki/Yu_Mengyu), national table tennis player. - 26 October – Shayna Ng, national bowler. - 13 December – [Ian Fang](/wiki/Ian_Fang), actor. ## Deaths - 12 January – Lee Lim, artistic photographer (b. 1931). - 15 January – Madai Puthan Damodaran Nair, former legislative assemblyman for [Seletar Constituency](/wiki/Seletar_Constituency) (b. 1920). - 23 March – [Lee Dai Sor](/wiki/Lee_Dai_Sor), [Cantonese](/wiki/Cantonese) storyteller (b. 1913). - 11 October – Haji Ya'acob bin Mohamed, former politician and diplomat (b. 1925). - 20 October – [T. J. D. Campbell](/wiki/T._J._D._Campbell), former [Director, General Staff of the Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Chief_of_Defence_Force_(Singapore)#List_of_officeholders_(1965–1990)) (b. 1922). title: 1989 in Singapore
